greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Multiplication table of the triangular numbers read by antidiagonals.
comment: The number of rectangles to be found in a grid of size X by y. For example a(2, 2) = 9 since a 2 x 2 grid contains one rectangle of size 2 X 2, 4 of size 1 X 2 and 4 of size 1 X 1. - _Hugo van der Sanden_, May 24 2007
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened
mathematica: a[n_, k_] := Binomial[k + 1, 2]*Binomial[n + 1, 2]; Table[a[n - k + 1, k], {n, 10}, {k, n, 1, -1}] // Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 22 2017 *)
results.author: Douglas Stones (dssto1(AT)student.monash.edu.au), Sep 04 2004
